intro: Miconia alpina, commonly known as the alpine miconia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
